alert.note: Alert for Newport; Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Barnstable, southeastern Plymouth, southeastern Bristol, northeastern Washington and Newport Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from New Bedford to near Portsmouth. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and tropical downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... New Bedford, Fall River, Barnstable, Dartmouth, Falmouth, North Kingstown, Newport, Marion, Wareham, Sandwich, Bourne, Portsmouth, Middletown, Fairhaven, Tiverton, Westport, Mashpee, Acushnet, Mattapoisett and Jamestown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
